channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Agribusiness giant Elders has almost doubled its first half profit to $52 million with a stronger performance by all key divisions, as farmer confidence jumps.
item.title: Elders' profit rises as farm confidence swells

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The ABC has filed its defence in a legal battle between Peter V'landys and the national broadcaster, arguing that their expose on the horse racing industry did not defame the Racing NSW boss.
item.title: Racehorse abuse expose did not defame V'landys, ABC argues

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria to partially reopen pubs, restaurants as global COVID-19 cases top 4.7 million, Australian death toll stands at 99

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Sitting MPs had until Monday to nominate for the election and there was speculation about whether Ms Trad would put up her hand again.
item.title: Jackie Trad will fight for her seat on the backbench

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: police break up weekend parties and authorities investigate COVID-19 case in Rockhampton

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Inside, the man allegedly donned a cowboy hat he found on a coat rack that belonged to a staff member and took himself on a tour of the exhibits.
item.title: Man charged after alleged night at the museum

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The North Rockhampton Nursing Centre was locked down on Friday as hundreds of staff and residents were tested for the virus.
item.title: Rockhampton tests negative 'in what can only be described as a miracle'

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: The number of confirmed coronavirus cases worldwide has almost reached 4.7 million,
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Premier announces $2.7 billion construction package, McDonald's shuts a dozen Victorian restaurants

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The federal government has provided a three-step roadmap to start carefully relaxing limits on our movement. Here's how each state is easing its coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: COVID-19: What are the public health rules now?

item.description: Shutdown comes as government unveils $2.7b recovery package to help rest of the state emerge from lockdown.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Collingwood and Sydney players are among the first in the AFL to return to training in groups, taking to the field on Monday morning as the AFL's restrictions eased.
item.title: AFL players return to group training

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A decade of discovery at a Queensland fossil site has uncovered a new species of giant kangaroo, and proof that climate changes killed megafauna, not humans.
item.title: Groundbreaking research rewrites Australia's ancient history

item.description: The Snowbirds, Canada's equivalent of the RAAF's Roulettes, were deployed as a morale booster amid lockdown measures for the public.
item.title: Canadian acrobatic jet crashes amid pandemic show

item.description: Alexandre Lacazette is in line for investigation and possible punishment from Arsenal after being filmed with a balloon at his mouth, having previously been warned over inhaling nitrous oxide.
item.title: Arsenal's Lacazette in balloon probe

item.description: Red, sore and sometimes itchy swellings on toes that look like chilblains, something doctors see on people who've spent a long time outdoors in the cold.
item.title: 'COVID toes,' other rashes latest possible rare virus signs

item.dc:creator: Nicole Precel
item.description: Workers from the affected restaurants have been told to stay home for two weeks and are being advised to be tested for COVID-19.
item.title: McDonald's closes 12 restaurants after a delivery driver tests positive to COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Izack Rodda, Isaac Lucas and Harry Hockings were told by the Queensland Reds not to bother arriving for training on Monday after refusing to accept pay cuts.
item.title: Super Rugby players stood down after refusing to accept pay cuts

item.description: Friends have paid tribute on social media to 21-year-old Maddie Morgan and boyfriend Jack Bryant, 23, who were expecting their first child in less than three weeks.
item.title: Perth man of ICU after horror crash killed pregnant girlfriend

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 has gained 65 points, or 1.2 per cent, since opening. Materials, healthcare, energy, and real estate are out-performing.
item.title: ASX jumps higher at opening, Elders doubles first half profit

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police enlisted the help of a rescue helicopter about 4.15am on Monday after the man was unable to be pulled from the waters by crew mates.
item.title: Search under way for fisherman missing from trawler off Sunshine Coast

item.description: Amid a once-in-a-century deadly pandemic, Trump has inserted his ego squarely into the US response while simultaneously minimising his own role.
item.title: Trump shrinks power of the US presidency in response to pandemic

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Police seize MDMA, methylamphetamine, cocaine, LSD and psilocybine in drug stings targeting the sale of drugs over encrypted applications.
item.title: 'Parents surprised' as WA police charge 60 people for encrypted app drug deals

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The 31-year-old was stopped while driving south on the M1 in Sydney's northern suburbs, about four hours after the bodies were discovered north of Brisbane.
item.title: Son charged in NSW after slain parents found in Qld bed and breakfast

item.description: Syria's telco authority said a deadline for a cellular company owned by the cousin of President Bashar Assad to pay back its debts to the state has ended.
item.title: Signs of Assad family feud emerge in Syria

item.description: He has long been criticised for how he ran the company he founded but the coronavirus has presented Facebook's 36-year-old CEO with an opportunity.
item.title: Tightening his grip: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg becomes a 'wartime' CEO

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: Restaurants, bars and cafes across WA will open their doors for on-premise service as eager customers fight for limited seat after what seems an eternity of home eating for patrons and proprietors.
item.title: Moving feast for Perth as revamped venues reopen with verve

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: West Australian farmer Paul O'Meehan was days away from planting his annual barely crop when news of a looming trade war between Australia and China flooded his Twitter feed.
item.title: Caught in a trade war with China WA farmers face an uncertain future

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: As of midnight, WA lifted some of the restrictions that have seen the number of active infections drop to next to nothing, but also destroy the state's economy.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Pubs and restaurants set for limited reopening as some intrastate borders come down

item.dc:creator: Gary Adshead
item.description: The cancellation raises questions about other big events in Perth this year, such as the Perth Royal Show and the Christmas Pageant.
item.title: Perth's Australia Day Skyworks cancelled amid coronavirus uncertainty

item.description: After a rash of violent social distancing arrests involving people of colour, the city this week eased distancing enforcement.
item.title: New York state widens testing as mayor lashes public on night life

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for positive start to week

item.description: A 35-year-old pair of Nike sneakers worn on the court by Michael Jordan have fetched almost $900,000 at an auction in New York.
item.title: If the shoe fits: Game-worn Air Jordan 1s fetch record price

item.description: Leading scorer Robert Lewandowski converted a spot kick and Benjamin Pavard headed in a corner to keep Bayern in the driving seat for an eighth straight title.
item.title: Bayern ease past Union as Bundesliga draws record TV numbers

item.description: Emirates could cut 30 per cent of its jobs and speed up the retirement of its A380 fleet to cut costs amid the coronavirus outbreak, reports Bloomberg.
item.title: Emirates may cut 30,000 jobs, retire A380s sooner: report

item.description: The Fed chair says the speed of the US economy's recovery depends on finding a COVID-19 vaccine.
item.title: 'We really don't know': Fed chair warns US economic recovery could stretch through end of 2021, depends on vaccine

item.description: The annual meeting comes at a time when the WHO has attracted unprecedented global attention, and international scrutiny for its handling of the coronavirus.
item.title: WHO set to host assembly amid coronavirus controversy

item.description: Some of the online posts falsely claim that Ahmaud Arbery was carrying a hammer and wearing boots when he was killed, analysts said.
item.title: Far-right groups spread false claims about shooting victim Ahmaud Arbery: analysts

item.description: The ambassador was found in his bed in Herzliya by an embassy worker, officials said. Israeli police found no reason to suspect foul play his his death.
item.title: Chinese ambassador is found dead at home in Israel

item.description: Two major European leaders have told their citizens not to wait to be saved by a coronavirus vaccine.
item.title: Italy, UK send stark warnings: the world cannot wait for a vaccine

item.description: With borders closed, employers cannot rely on foreign labour to fill skills shortages, which means we need to develop the technological skills of our labour force during this crisis.
item.title: Coronavirus pandemic gives Australia a chance to fix our skills gaps in technology

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The state government was on Sunday frantically finalising its pandemic public transport plan as more Sydneysiders return to work and students go back to school full-time.
item.title: Pop-up car parks planned as 'nervous' Premier fears public transport risk

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: NAB will temporarily hire more staff as it starts assessing the status of more than 80,000 mortgage holders who have put payments on hold due to COVID-19.
item.title: NAB to hire 400 staff to help assess COVID customer status

item.description: As China huffs and puffs about trade, Australia must either hold the line on its calls for a pandemic inquiry or risk its international credibility.
item.title: Australia must calmly hold its ground with China

item.description: For those of us lucky enough to still be in work, the biggest shift has been from office block to kitchen table.
item.title: So, what does the new 'normal' look like for women?

item.description: You can see the fear in the eyes of the medical staff when they enter my room. The other night, I could hear them whispering on the other side of the door about sending me to ICU.
item.title: It took me 50 days and three hospital stays to recover from COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Consumers receiving the coronavirus supplement and stimulus payments are shopping much more than normal.
item.title: Spending would collapse without crisis payments to households

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Country towns along the corridor would benefit from job opportunities and economic growth.
item.title: East coast mega-region would boost national growth: report

item.description: I remember tears welling in my 12-year-old eyes when it looked like E.T. was going to die and later, my mother gently falling asleep as a chum and I watched Tron, feeling like we’d just seen the future.
item.title: George Street cinemas captured movie of our lives

item.dc:creator: Andrew Charlton
item.description: Infection rates are down and spending is up. Time to wind back the generous government support programs, right? Wrong.
item.title: Fragile economy cannot cope with early end to government support

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: James Roberts' partner has opened up on the events that led to the South Sydney centre checking himself into rehab.
item.title: Roberts eyes Roosters showdown just seven days after checking out of rehab
